intro: Henningia schiwana, commonly known as the Schiwana heath, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
